title: Great app, one piece of feedback.
text: I’ve been using the app to book for the last five years. I just started hosting and am surprised how well the app works in hosting mode! My one piece of feedback has to do with the messages. I think it would be a nice feature to have some visual indication in the app that the user has unread messages without going to the messages screen. Perhaps when there are unread messages, the icon could have lines in it? I get a notification icon on the app badge, then it always takes me awhile tapping around the app to figure out what it is I’m being notified of. Most of the time it’s a new message, but there’s nothing in the app that leads me to that conclusion.

title: Life changer
text:
We purchased our home with Air BNB in mind. The master suite is on the main floor and had its own sliding doors. I was able to make it a private suite by adding a wall and a door on the other side of my laundry room. I also fenced in a private patio for guests. 
Having the extra income has been a life changer for us as we have moved to a new town and will now be able to not stress about getting our careers going immediately. My wife has her career but I’be been able to be a stay home dad for the last year which has Ben the greatest gift I’ve ever received. As I start my business my wife will take a step back and enjoy more time with our daughter as well over the next year before she starts kindergarten. 
Thank you Air BNB!!!!

title: Hidden Covid policies
text:
After over a month of back and forth with “ambassadors” and trying to give them every opportunity to make things right, I’ve given up on this company. They have “an internal only policy” that they may cancel an in-process stay if a guest tests positive and will not assist in any finding of additional accommodation nor will they discuss with the guest first. We notified a host that we had a positive test result come back after check in so that a repair person would not be exposed to it and for that, our reservation was cancelled the next day (we were refunded). We did not want to leave but the host threatened to have us forcibly removed and with children, we didn’t want to subject them to that kind of situation. Air BnB provided no guidance or comfort, just apologies for the inconvenience. 

Again, this policy is not posted and they won’t share it but they will activate it against you. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND USING AIR BNB UNTIL COVID IS A DISTANT MEMORY.

title: Terrible refund policy
text: Requested a refund for one night of a month long stay for a plumbing issue. Airbnb refused the refund stating that because the plumbing issue didn't occur during the first 24 hours of our stay, that they couldn't issue a refund. That day, we had to cancel our plans to attend to the plumber. A toilet clog caused septic water and feces to overflow into the shower. Host did not clean the shower or send anyone to clean it, so we bought cleaning supplies and cleaned the feces and sewage ourselves which was hazardous. We thought we would be refunded 1-night as a courtesy for such a terrible experience, but Airbnb refused. I will not be using Airbnb after this. There simply isn't enough diligence done to make sure that hosts have a clean and functional home which is safe to live in. Our host's kitchen was also infested with roaches. Even after sending Airbnb photos of the feces in the shower and roaches in kitchen, they still refused a refund of any kind.

title: Avoid this app
text: After more and more bad experiences with Airbnb I will NOT use the app anymore. I went to Brasil recently and the 2 places out of the 4 places that I rented had the wrong address and wrong photos of the buildings. In Mexico the experience was even worse, 2 places that I paid almost the price of a hotel, did not give me towels or had any air conditioning in the room. Another place in Acapulco had much better photos on the app, better furniture, they even showed a photo of a pool that was a public pool, not even belongs to the house, it was smelling mold, and when I asked my money back because we found Holliday Inn for a better price and next to the beach, they only gave us 80% of what I paid. Now I left an Apple TV on my last stay and they suspended my account with no reason. Now I can’t coordinate with the hostess when they are sending my device. And they’re keep sayin that they will contact me via email but they never do. What a ridiculous experience.

title: Auto lists feature is anti-user, please fix
text:
I love Airbnb. I have used it as a traveler, a host and collaborative travel tool with friends for years. I vastly prefer meeting real people and staying in unique places. Loooove the offline experience and used to really look to Airbnb for product design inspiration too. 

But wow, I am SO frustrated with the list behavior now that I am looking at VRBO for the first time. Might as well use spreadsheets- the lists feature has been rendered a torturous anti-user disaster.

Every time I save a place Airbnb auto-generates a new list. It won’t use the last list and I have to double check every single move I make now.

I can guess why you’d create smart lists and may result in metrics bumps in aggregate as you push people into suggestions- but they’re not smart at all. 

It’s worse on desktop. There were so many auto lists I couldn’t find my list for an earlier leg of a trip because of an almost invisible ‘see all’ button hiding behind a sea of lists I did not create myself. Editing / deleting these duplicative lists takes forever because you cannot batch delete or consolidate the auto created lists. I can’t rename lists either?!

 Super frustrating experience. On top of the weird sampling they do on the map. It’s a real pain.

title: Airbnb does not back the costumer instead the host
text: We booked one night and the bed sheets had multiple bedsheet stains multiple colors. Description stated lockbox for the keys. No lockbox walked in with open door keys on the counter. That was uncomfortable not knowing if someone had been inside. 2nd there was hair on the bath shower floor mat. Airbnb claimed it could have been corrected by the host. I said no way why would I want to sleep on that bed. Asked if they could reimburse me and they claimed they can’t. I asked  the supervisor if she would stay and she said no. Even then she would not reimburse me. Terrible, definitely worth spending the same amount a cheaper hotel. When Airbnb does not have you back when they host the name and site for the host to post their places. At this point it feels like a scam and nothing they can do. I suffered the cost of the night, cleaning fee and service fee when I didn’t spend more then 15 min in the place before leaving. Don’t recommend it, stay away.

title: Unreasonable Response
text:
We tried to book a home that advertises room for 14 people. A group of 10 adults planned to rent the home the weekend before Halloween. Airbnb prevented us from booking because it appeared we “may be having a party”. I called Airbnb to report the issue and they escalated it. I then received an email stating that my request was still denied due to the size of our party. I then reached out to the host/homeowner directly and they gave the okay for a group of 10 no problem. I called Airbnb back and asked that someone there reach out to the HOMEOWNER so that we could be approved to rent the home. Again, denied. 
We chose initially to use Airbnb so we could get travel insurance and have better trip cancellation options but after all this trouble, I gave up using Airbnb. 
We booked the home through its own website and bought travel insurance and saved money! Airbnb got none of it! 
Won’t use them again for travel.

title: Zero customer support
text: I’m going on an international trip and used Airbnb to book most of my stays. Due to booking a high number (3) stays in different countries on a single day, my account was flagged for possible fraudulent behavior. Despite having taken my ID picture and profile photo on the app on the same day as the bookings the app decided I was fraudulent. I have contacted customer support numerous times but they’ve obviously outsourced to some call center in a 3rd world country. These people are great but clearly do not know the intricacies of the app and have not been helpful in getting my account un-flagged. The best they could tell me to do was wait a day to try booking again or use a different payment method (both of which did not work). I will be using a competitor from now on as fixing my account is too much work for me (and frankly I’m not even sure is possible with these terrible customer service resources).

title: AirBnB lost their way
text:
AirBnB was my favorite way to travel. Unfortunately, they have lost their original spirit. In areas where they offer airbnb plus they no longer show my kind of hosts - close to real life - but only show the 5-star locations. I’m not interested in that! If i was, i would go to a 5-star resort!

Second issue: airbnb asks host to point at their house on the map - so the exact location is stored in their system. Yet, they refuse to use that data and instead go by address. That works in the US, but not in Central America, India, or other countries where street addresses are not used. There you end up in totally wrong places, even dangerous situations!
To me, this is a serious flaw; one that is very easy to fix for them. Yet, they don’t want to for years now!!! 😡
Every booking it is always a problem getting the exact location and finding the place. Always have to fight the system to get to contact host through whatsapp and get exact location from them that way. 

Using other services more and more - it’s a shame!!! Original AirBnB idea was excellent! A huge contribution to world peace and cultural tolerance building. Now, they got too big and are just trying to get more money! So sad!!! 😥

title: Good application horrible support
text: App is good and easy to use. However couple of glitches 1) be cautious when you enter your official email and is also a frequent traveler because you may not be able to delete the office email from the preferences and you’ll get zero support from their support team. They don’t want you to do this. Again by entering office email you get zero benefits too. All marketing gimmicks. The pain is, you’ll have to wait until the final stay is over (until your final booking) to remove the office email from the account, which is rather annoying and bothersome with all marketing stuff arriving frequently. 2) Another thing is there is no easy way to get the address of the location. It should be clear and visible in the main page when you complete your purchase. Hopefully they’ll correct this.

title: Platform sides with host
text:
I was a pretty happy Airbnb user for about a year until I got into an annoying spat with a host. The host refused to meet for check in at 9:45pm because he had dinner plans despite his check in window being 4-10pm.  He also refused to allow me to self check in, even though I told him I would not be available before 9:45. 

We had gotten fed up with each other after the messages grew hostile, and I asked him to refund me so I could find something else if he couldn’t accommodate. He refused and begrudgingly told me he’d meet me when I asked. 

After this I gave him a nice review because the room was nice and he accommodated, but he left a nasty review of me as a guest AND responded to my review to further let out his anger about changing his schedule for me. 

As the guest, you have no option to respond to reviews like the host does. Also, Airbnb does not tell you this, but if a host gives you a “thumbs down” as a rating you are no longer able to instantly book rooms.

This was a totally petty fight, and in the grand scheme of things reviews don’t matter much, but the experience was annoying and ruined my mood for the start and end of my vacation, and I wasn’t able to do anything about it because I decided to leave a nice review. I complained to Airbnb about the host’s hostility and the message was ignored. Switch to Vrbo or use hotels to save yourself the headache.

title: Unfair review system
text: Airbnb isn’t bad for finding a place to stay, but their policy on reviews needs work. I was accused by a host of stealing something in their review of my stay which I did not take. Through further exchanges they did not provide any evidence as to why they thought I stole something and said “sorry to blame you”, but also declined to remove or alter the review. After 48 hours it becomes permanent. Upon contacting Airbnb support about it they said it didn’t violate their rules so they would have to leave it up. Their claim is they want to be about trust and transparency. So the first thing any future potential host will see about me is “he stole something”. They will have to open the review to actually see my response, and even if they see that it’s still their word against mine. Update your policy so that if claims like this are made they actually have to give some evidence since they reviews are so permanent.

title: Review about the Airbnb support and Host in Naigara falls house
text: Airbnb clearly specify that house is not in safe location to live in the property renters can deny to stay. In Niagara, we paid the full rent a house at 1734 Elmwood avenue, Niagarafalls, NY (hosted by Moosa & Hiba). After reaching the house that neighborhood is having boarded house at surroundings and really scared to live. We have family of old aged parents, newborn with kids. Really scared and requested for my money to return. Now host is not ready to giveback any penny and Airbnb supporting the host simply. Not caring the customers. Worst customer not support the renters safety.. I wasted $435 from packet without checking in the house, even I’m ready to give up the cleaning charges. I want my money back..I felt Airbnb , host Moosa and Hiba cheated our family, Don’t use this app and especially don’t stay above mentioned house in Niagara. This is an alert to for all customers who rent the house using Airbnb. Beware for cheat host and supported by Airbnb

title: Flashy and Trashy
text:
I’ve hosted and traveled with Airbnb for nearly a decade and it seems that with each passing year the software becomes less user friendly, bloated, and tricky to use.

I use both an iPhone 12 Pro and a Google Pixel 6. On both devices Airbnb regularly (every day) fails to update its “today” page with relevant notifications, messages, and updates.

Navigation on the Pixel disappears every other time I use the app and I have to force close it and reopen in order to navigate again (move between a reservation detail page and my inbox, for example).

The one innovation Airbnb brought to the market is double-blind ratings with identity verification. This creates a market where there was none before. However, Airbnb has failed to provide any new subsequent innovation, leaving the entire community vulnerable to the company’s monopoly power over room rentals around the world.

Hosts are not permitted to cancel a reservation without asking for permission from Airbnb first. There is an ominous warning that they can claw back money in your account and ruin your ratings just for canceling a booking for any reason.

I look forward to the day when any other company decides to step up and start providing a competing service. Until then we are stuck with Airbnb.

title: Good platform idea but terrible customer service
text: I became a host recently and everything is fine until it’s not. When you have to reach out to customer service it’s always like pulling teeth. Most of the time the issue is not resolved and never is it resolved on the first call. Almost all of their reps have trouble speaking English and are not empowered to help. They seem to be reading from a script and they only know how to apologize and thank you for being a super host. This continued even after I became super host although I was able to reach a human much quicker, the resolution process did not become any easier. After this long I really feel it is time to start considering other competitor apps. Before Airbnb was a monopoly but I think more recently there have been more worthy and growing competitors.

title: Security measures
text: I like Airbnb quite a bit. But I haven’t used it for a couple of years. That said, it’s my first choice when not using a hotel.  The problem I found is if you change your phone number you will never be able to use Airbnb again. This is not hyperbole. This is the absolute truth of what I’ve gone through the last 24 hours. I’ve tried everything I could from calling customer support to trying to respond to the emails that came in, but they have all fallen on deaf ears because I do not have access to my old phone number. Airbnb keeps sending security codes to that number and requiring I use it but that number doesn’t exist. I wish they would figure this out so I could use their service sometime in the future. Until then I’ll go to the other guy. But I can’t find what I’m looking for there most of the time.

title: Suggest improvement for App
text: I have had mainly positive experiences with my stats and host. My complaint is for the app. There needs to be a feature for host to charge you additional fees (pet fees) at the initial time of reservation. Currently a host has to send you a separate request for payment. These request do not appear on the notifications or messages on the app! Also,  I kept getting an error message when I logged into the site from my phone and went to the resolution center to send a payment; it kept referring to a request already sent from the host that I could not access! Luckily my perspective host sent me a follow up message and I was finally able to pay her after logging into the full site on a computer. This would have been an issue if I was already traveling or in a place without access to a computer.

title: A nice and relaxing place to stay
text:
The unit is located in the prime area of Mont Kiara.  It is one of the latest developments in the area.  You can find many nice restaurants, coffee shops and grocery stores just in the neighbourhood next door. 

The host is very hospitable, and explain all the amenities in details to the guests. 
The only thing that I will suggest is to put a clothes hook on the back of the toilet door so that we can hang our clothes while showering.
It will also be nice if the host provide a towel floor mat to be placed in front of the shower room since it is only partially closed ( no door) ; therefore, the water will splash out while we are bathing. 

The other thing that can be improved is the availability of more trash cans in the unit since the building has no garbage bin room on its floor, we find it troublesome as to where to throw the trash. 

Other than that, our stay is awesome.  Except for those of you who drive a car, you should be willing to pay an extra paid parking in the premise which cost you RM 2/ hour, except on weekend they have a maximum charge of RM 10/day.

If you want to stay in tge heart of Mont Kiara, then this is your right choice.👍

title: NIGHTMARE CUSTOMER SERVICE
text: Worse experience, now booking a flight home after 2 nightmare days on vacation! Couldn’t relax and have a good time on vacation because our Airbnb got cancelled the morning of the trip after we already got in town… and a refund was sent back to us and would take 15 days. You think I’m forking out another $1500 to a company that couldn’t even give us good customer service you’re wrong. I spend 9 hours the first day trying to figure out where we would stay. I spend 13 hours the 2nd day doing the same thing. Today I’m just booking flights back home. Worse customer service I have ever received in my life. Talked to a supervisor once after asking about 6 times to talk to one, and waiting over 24 hours just to talk to a supervisor. Who couldn’t even give us the 3 day stay for the cancellation, we got 2 days. WILL NEVER USE AIRBNB AGAIN! Worse customer service and vacation in my life!

title: Discrimination policy is a scam!
text: The host Marcel, at the Bougainvillea Hotel in Nigeria is a disrespectful racist! I made reservations while visiting months ago and he never responded to my messages, in fact my reservation expired and I had to book somewhere else. So, I notified him of his poor conduct (recently) and he definitely had time to respond with his disrespectful attitude towards me. He called me names and sent a reservation that totalled 14,000 USD for the days, when the room would cost roughly 300 USD! He kept messaging me disrespectful responses and I reported him for the third time, then blocked him. The worst thing about my situation is that AIrbnb is completely fine with this host practices! They refuse to do anything about this matter so I decided to delete the app—after spending thousands as a customer! Horrible company, with an anti discrimination policy that’s only used as a front. People of color, go elsewhere to receive better and dignified services!

title: Injury During a Trip
text: I had a horrible experience with Airbnb. I used to use them all the time until my pet got severely injured during a trip. After speaking with the host and Airbnb they stated they will refund me all my reservation money and vet bills. However, they took 4 months to answer me and tell me that because the host decided not to give me a refund after all, the cancellation policy goes in effect. Since it’s already 4 months after, the cancellation policy states I will not get a refund! I’ve heard that when you have a serious problem Airbnb usually looks out for itself, but I never thought I would actually experience it. Now that I have, I will never use Airbnb again and I will look to seek legal matter against them too. They lied to me for 4 months saying multiple things until they finally denied the refund. Very unprofessional, be ware that when you have a problem, they will not help at all!!

title: AirBnb is not safe
text: I booked a stay in what seemed like a decent and clean apartment in a foreign city through Airbnb, boy was it deceptive. The place itself was nothing like the pictures, it was a complete pig pen. There was trash and clutter everywhere and it smelled like cat droppings. The bathroom has been converted into a huge litter box. The host was present and he started complaining that Airbnb hasn’t given him enough money and he wanted more. When I tried to leave he tried to force me to give him more money before I left! It was a horrible experience and when I complained to Airbnb the communication has been spotty to say the least. You’re probably better off in a hotel, you’re really rolling the dice with Airbnb. I can’t imagine what would have happened if I were a woman. The bottom line is it’s not safe and they don’t really have any measures in place to vet the hosts or their places, so I can’t imagine how they could make it safe.

title: False prices = scam
text: Its strange no one has legally sued AirBnB for the false prices they show on the property and when you attempt to book it they price goes up by $500 because now they have added cleaning fees, service fees and taxes.  The strange part is these fees vary by a lot in the same neighborhood for the same types of houses. Its like the car dealership, I see a company advertising one price and then when you see the final price they add all sorts of fees.. showing all the price down at the time booking is not being honest. If you want to be honest show the per night charges just like a hotel up front minus standard taxes! We recently stayed at a AirBnB where the house had no Air Conditioning… of course the property listing only said heat but why would it even occur to you that the house on the beach will come without Air Condition. The heat and humidity at night was unbearable.. most stays at AirBnB is getting more and more disappointing.

title: I wish I could rate it lower than 1 star
text: I have never been so disgusted with the irresponsibility of a company. This is a company where scams are frequent, local laws and permitting ignored, bait and switch on properties common practice, and yet, customer support is almost ZERO. They refuse to employ anyone actually helps their customers OR their hosts, and in my case because of some arbitrary algorithmic decision made somewhere by someone my super host account that I had operettas successfully for THREE years was suspended during the height of the pandemic when I needed money the most; and now that I am out traveling again, I can’t even create a new account to rent with bc my phone number is locked in my old closed account! This is a terrible company that has survived on name recognition alone for years, much like F book, and I hope more people wake up to just how irresponsible and apathetic this service actually is toward its customers and hosts

title: Customer Service??? NOT!
text:
Reserved an airbnb in Hanahan, SC at the cost of $2600! I arrived late at night & found the house to be filthy with an intense smell of dog pee. I proceeded to purchase cleaning supplies the next day & cleaning for about 6 hours. I contacted the host & got the so called "partner". After sending emails w/photos & multiple texts, I was promised a refund for part of the cleaning fee (which I never received). Stay away from anything run by cvp in SC. After lengthy conversations & sending emails to airbnb, I like others was also refused any type of compensation. I would have left but having a lg dog there were no other option & driving home to CO was not feasible. This was my first time seeing my youngest son in almost 2 years. He just graduated from Navy NUC training. Also my first vaca in almost 3 years!!
I will never use airbnb again nor would I recommend anyone else to.
Btw, house also had roaches & nothing was done about it😒

title: Superb! Try Luxury, Try Neighborhoods, Replace Hotels with Dream Home w/out the headaches!
text: Learned of this on LiveFearless with Sam Botta - Thank You! Airbnb hosting literally pulled me past a tough spot in life after being in inpatient care for nearly two years after a hit and run driver caused s major stroke which caused me to need extra income! Plus, I am able to stay in places you see on those entertainment interviews inside celebrity homes... in areas where the hotel prices would have been more expensive! Further this site is Safer than Craigslist because the verification process works with this specific purpose. App knows how to make your search easy, booking is fast on this app. I know the founders as friends in real life, they sincerely care! Enjoy! Be inspired!

title: Great app, but has had the same bug for years
text:
I’ve been using the Airbnb app for years as a guest and as a host, and I love how convenient and useful it is. The only thing I’ve got a problem with is that there is a bug on the app where it shows me as having a notification, but I don’t. 

In my case, it USED to say I needed to update the app, but I couldn’t because it was already the latest version… now it just has a notification dot and no reason. 

This is the second time I’ve spoken to their techs about it (last time was probably over two years ago): 

The first time, I was told they’d look into it. Nothing happened. 

This time, I was told that it is normal and lots of users have to deal with it, and that there was nothing to be done to fix it. He suggested I write a review about it, and told me the design team checks these periodically. So…

Tl;dr- The app is great. Customer service is great. There is a bug (mentioned above) that needs fixing. It doesn’t hurt anyone, but having a false notification constantly visible has been annoying me for years.  Please fix it.

title: Overpriced terrible service and no support
text:
Now Airbnb prices are far higher than hotels and you get nothing for your money. The spaces are unclean, you have a random person making invasive rules and making you feel uncomfortable- as if you are paying to make the landlord happy. And yes Airbnb has ruined the rental market for normal people. There is no excuse to use this! Every booking now has a huge “cleaning fee” - am I not paying a host so much to begin with so they can clean the space and then the wrapping huge Airbnb fee - all added on-top of the presented price. 

There are so many horror stories! Like so many tech scams - the company starts off with low prices then dominates the whole market and puts prices sky high! You cannot believe the prices charged for even slum lord standard rooms and spaces! This company does so much harm to communities additionally - stay elsewhere!

title: NOT ADA FRIENDLY
text:
In their website they claim to take “discrimination very seriously” with 24/7 support and assistance. If you have a SERVICE ANIMAL or DISABILITY, don’t expect them to help if you have any issues with your stay. I’ve been waiting 3 HOURS for a response from their “specialized team,” although two different support members put the “urgent” tag on it. It’s 2:05 am right now and I’m sitting in my car in an unknown area hoping AirBnB can find a solution that doesn’t make ME pay for a hotel room. I guess I should’ve stayed at the house where they disrespected my disability for just one more night like the customer “support” member told me 🤔

If you’re ADA and think you’ll receive any support with accommodations or service animal issues, stop by your closest gas station and become friends with the cashier, at least you’ll have someone to talk to while AirBnB “urgently” works on your case for hours without any updates.

title: The best app and customer experience I have ever had!
text: I believe this is my first review on appstore because normally I am too lazy to write anything and just rate the apps with Stars. However, Airbnb is different. I have had great experience with this company. I have had several trips using the app and once the property appeared to be much worse than advertised. We could not stay there even for one night. We had to involve Airbnb to help us with the refund. We got the best customer experience ever in just one day after involving Airbnb team. I would like to personally thank the guy named "Ronald T" from Airbnb. He made the process so simple and customer oriented. Ronald, if you are reading it, me and my friends are extremely grateful to you! 👌🤗😍

title: Glitchy interface, multiple issues and customer service rep that left
text:
This sucked big time, I lost three bookings because there were multiple glitches in the software when checking out. Even worse was customer service that said I had to wait 24 hours for the glitch to be resolved, well it wasn’t resolved I lost the bookings and while they were looking for a resolution in the meantime (after being on customer service for hours) the customer service rep Gian, said let me look into something and JUST LEFT. Lol I kid you not it was a huge slap in the face Air b &b has gone WAY DOWNHILL. Don’t forget they will ask for your government Id and a bunch of other private info, just look at the tracking they do in the app info. They can see your browser history even. You know that personal info is getting stolen and sold.

Yeah thumbs down. Worst booking experience I’ve ever had. It’s not that hard

title: Terrible support. Downward spiral in service and atrocious attitude towards customers.
text:
Their service has got worse to the point that hotels are much better choice. The last place I rented was unhygienic with throw up from previous renters on the property - there is simply no recourse when something like this happens. You will find out when it happens to you. 

We booked a place that charges over 3k for a week and they cancelled two days before we checked in. I call airbnb and they say there is nothing wrong with it. We booked the place months ago and now everything in the area way too expensive. We are mid travel and now have to deal with the consequences of this cancellation. If you as a renter would cancel before two days, you would pay airbnb fees and 80% of the rent for cancelling two days prior. But since the owner of the place cancelled, airbnbs message to us was screw you!

Next time we will go to a hotel or VRBO which was always reliable.

title: Scammers Paradise
text: My host filed a claim saying she had damaged property and missing property when nothing was damaged and nothing was taken. I tried to resolve the situation but she was acting way out of line threatening to take me to court. She said she wanted $100 or she’ll file a lawsuit so not wanting to deal with the legal headache I ended up just settling for her demands. I’m going to try to talk to airbnb customer support but 72hrs for a response is ridiculous.. That lady was awful and I’m never booking with airbnb again because it’s not fair that hosts can take advantage of guests like this.. My host admitted that it wasn’t her first time doing this and that this is what she does for a living... she rips people off using airbnb... if you make the risky decision to use airbnb I would call your host or meet up in person to make sure they’re not a scammer and to make sure the place you’re planning on staying is as advertised on the listing... I will never make the mistake of booking with airbnb again...

title: Absolutely terrible
text: The WORST company I have ever felt with. Lost my job due to COVID-19 ao of course I had to cancel and it took me a MONTH!!! For 3 weeks every time I’d get with customer support (through Messenger and email) I would tell them my situation and they would just copy and paste the same thing to me then when i would try to ask questions, they’d never reply. After try time and time again I finally got with someone who would reply to me and it still took him a week to get my money back to me AND he treated me like I was stupid and didn’t understand anything. AND the only way I got my money back was because the host agreed to it. Airbnb’s policy was overly strict about the situation and just assumed people would be traveling again within a month. They don’t care about the customers, only the most they can make off of them. I’ll never use this god awful business again. VRBO just got a new costumer

title: Using Airbnb app
text: My husband became addicted to this site. At first he called it “Air-nub” LOL.  Every town we would want to go to, he’d be looking up a place to stay on Airbnb. We’ve stayed in Venice, FL, Charleston, SC, Sylva, NC, and Bethlehem, PA. Staying in these places is way better than a hotel! Hosts have been wonderful and we’ve enjoyed home away from home.  Most recently, my daughter, grandsons, fur babies and I needed to evacuate the area for Hurricane Florence. I was thrilled to be able to find places to stay and the hosts were very accommodating.  I did hear of some free places offered to evacuees, but I didn’t find that to be the case.  I’m just happy my family and I had some place to go.  Can’t imagine having to stay in hotel room; I probably won’t ever again!

title: Thankful for Airbnb!
text: I’ve booked over a dozen times now for both business and leisure trips and have enjoyed being able to stay in unique homes. Being able to book a whole house is so much nicer and less costly than a hotel room!! Finding the right option in the right location has been much easier than expected. The booking is super easy. All of the owners have been responsive and gracious. While not all places have been exactly my taste in decor they’ve been as advertised. The only time I had a surprise it was my own fault of rushing to book at the last minute and not reading the info correctly. It was smaller than expected but in great new, clean shape. I look forward to more trips ahead.

title: Have used 10+ times now
text: & has always been so worth it. Airbnb has allowed me to stay in some extremely unique and beautiful properties that I otherwise would never have had the luxury of staying in. I’ve noticed oftentimes Airbnb has extremely competitive rates even in comparison to local hotels. My thought when using this app is oftentimes “why book a hotel when I can probably book a whole house or extremely nice cabin, or condo (if I’m in a city). I’ve used it so many times now and I’ve always had wonderful experiences every time. This app has really enabled me and many of my loved ones to have and share many great memories in wonderful places. I’ve loved it since I’ve downloaded it. Thank you!!

title: I will NOT be using
text: Airbnb is a wonderful concept of bed and breakfast for the 21st century. Yet sometimes you're going to run into people who just shouldn't be hosting or people who are trying to scam you. Well we were definitely scammed. In the biography of the apartment we rented, it stated that there would be no other people staying there and that the host would NOT be there. Which is why I chose that place. When we arrived our host was not only late but then when he showed up he did NOT formally introduce himself nor show us the apartment. We had walked in and there he was just doing work like he was staying there. We then soon realized that indeed he was staying there. He did so without mentioning it al all. He was there the entire 9 days & was very disturbing to the peace that I wanted. And then when the stay was over 3 weeks later the host has the nerve to charge 1400$ for so calls damage? Damage? What damage! This was a complete SCAM. & I partially believe the host was and is racist.

title: Terrible customer service
text:
Host canceled two days before a stay booked months in advance. Total cost was $1200 including taxes and fees. Airbnb gave me a meager $65 credit but the fine print is it can only be used on a booking with a nightly of $1200 BEFORE taxes and fees.. this makes absolutely no sense and I had to go back and forth for hours with their terrible customer service before finally getting ahold of a manager who gave me an exception to use the $65 credit. I then got bit head to toe from Bed Bugs at that stay and even though I sent in photographic proof they responded by offering a meager 30% refund when it took me a month to heal from the bites and I had to pay an exterminator for my own home. 
Use this service at your own risk as anything that goes wrong during your stay will likely not get handled properly by their customer service call center in India and their terrible customer service model

title: DOES NOT PROTECT YOU FROM SCAMS
text: Extremely upset and dissatisfied with my experience with Airbnb. I stayed in an Airbnb in La Spezia, Italy and upon leaving I was accused of breaking a window. I 100% cross my heart swear to die did not break it. A third party from Airbnb got involved, but did absolutely nothing to communicate with me nor explain the situation. I emailed my mediator (if you can call them that) my side of the story and they didn’t address any of my questions such as what do the documents say (they were in Italian), what I was being charged for, why it was proven that I was at fault, etc. Obviously I’m upset with the scam of the Airbnb I stayed in, but I am more upset that Airbnb does not protect its customers from scams of this nature. My mediator informed me that my host had proved there was damage that needed to be repaired, but never did anyone state that it was proven I was at fault. Absolutely disgusted with this service and feel Airbnb must do more to advocate for its users.

title: To airBnb or not to AirBnb
text: People travel for different reasons; some go because everybody they know goes away once a year during the summer, so they sign up on a guided tour, hop on the bus and stay in a hotel together. Others go because they are want to be one with nature; they hook up their trailer and pedal up the mountains and down the hills. And then there’s is the curious traveler. She wants to see how the city and its inhabitants really live. What they buy at their food shops and what they say in lines. She wants to save on at least breakfast, yes,  but it’s more than economical or practical. She wants to get lost in the city and find her way beck yo the dropped pin. This traveler is the Airbnbier. She wants to Be. Airbnb created this rare opportunity for her who is looking to just Be....

title: Cancelled on me
text: Beware! I booked a trip to California 6mos in advanced, only for it to be cancelled hours before arriving. I even emailed the host at the crack of dawn just to confirm everything and nothing. Emailed around lunchtime, nothing.. finally while going through airport security in my there,  I get an email from the host, not confirming my previous emails , just stating my reservation has been cancelled. Seriously, an email? No common courtesy to call me about something like that. I had 4 children with me with no place to go when we arrive. I reached out to the number that was included with the automated cancellation email to speak with a real person about the situation. Maneer from customer service did an excellent job assisting the very best she could and I very much appreciated her service. My 1st trip to Cali was the worst experience due to the very last minute cancellation. I will do myself a favor and just book with hotels in the future. Never again Airbnb!

title: Pearl Apartments
text:
Thank you for a wonderful three days stay, so close to work, not have to deal with morning traffic. Need to bring your own spices, scran wrap, foil, or containers and I brought my own reversed osmosis water jug for drinking and cooking. 

However, I will not go back to that apt again due to two things...  

1). The close-in hallways with only the fans and no natural air flow does get really warm on hot days, harder on those who have allergies, asthma, or both.  Very poor ventilation in those hallways, especially during hot days. Need to add that on the information as a warning so people better prepared when arrive and to let them know to use portable wagon to help lighten up the loads so you do not have to carry. 

2). CC = Closed Captioning accessibility has been denied by not turning CC accessibility on so can use CC button on the remote control. CC button on the remote control click to turn on or off but in order for that CC button on the remote control to work, must turn on the highlight CC under accessibility through setting. The highlight accessibility to CC was turned off so I could not access. I’m not talking about Netflix nor the Apple, I’m talking about the TV itself.

title: AirBNB does not support hosts
text: I am constantly having to write Airbnb about guests who leave unfair reviews because they did not read my listing or do not understand how Airbnb is different from a hotel. The new updates make the review process more nuanced, but Airbnb needs to force guests to actually consider how they are rating hosts and to detail why they are giving a 4 over a 5. Guest’s ratings are very heavily weighted, and it is extremely difficult to maintain super host status when I get guests who leave less than a five star rating because they wish I had an amenity that is not in my listing and not even in my house. Every time I contact Airbnb about this issue I get some person who is probably underpaid and works only with pre-written messages and it’s completely unhelpful and moreover infuriating. There is no consideration for real life, nuance, or spirit of the policy. In my experience they never back me as a host.

title: Not what it used to be
text:
I have loved airbnb in the past and have whole heartedly supported this platform and service for years, but I can confidently say that this company shows more care and support for its hosts than its users. I recently received an extremely negative and critical review that I can only pin down to passive aggression rooted in racism. I left the Airbnb in great condition and the host claimed I had not and warned other users to not rent to me on my profile. Airbnb denied my request for the removal of the review, and were not accommodating to my request to properly post my reply to this bad review. They have built in features to prevent users from defending themselves against bad actors. The outsourced customer service that they use is a huge mess and full of inexperienced contracted workers.

POC BEWARE AND be aware of who you rent from because Airbnb will not be there in your defense.

title: DO NOT BOOK IN HOUSTON.
text: - My boyfriend and I decided to book first time air bnb in Houston, Texas. We booked with a lady named “Ashley.” Worst host ever. We booked a month in advance to our trip. We were notified that we were refunded because the owners previously damaged the place. But we decided to book with her again because she said everything would be ready. We got there and TV was not working properly and couch broke as soon as we sat back on it. We also had a few guests over.. NOT FOR A PARTY. but for a get together and we were charged 75$ per person. Also a 500$ fee because it was a “party.” Also a smoking fee because one of our guests hit a vape in THE GARAGE, not in the apartment itself because i made it known we could not smoke in there, so they didnt. She is making false accusations and making us pay 922$ in total after we had just paid around close to 700$ for 5 days. This is AIR BNB fraud. This is ridiculous.

title: Terrible Customer Service
text: We arrived at our Airbnb and contacted the host, only to have him tell us that he has sold the property and our reservation is not valid. We called the customer service help center, and the experience end to end was horrible. They refunded us the amount we payed for the original reservation and said they would help us find a replacement Airbnb and they did not. Since it was last minute, every Airbnb was very expensive. At one point were told that Airbnb would cover the difference, but it was not approved for multiple hours and someone else booked that listing in the meantime, even though we were told they had talked to the hosts and confirmed availability. We began the process again for a different listing and were told it would take days to process. So, in the end after calling 20 times over 16 hours we had to find alternative lodging ourselves and it costed a few thousand more than we anticipated paying.

title: Dishonest
text: Extremely disappointed to figure out they allow only certain feedback on a review for a place. We had left a review for a place we stayed at some good and some bad, only to see the good had been posted. The reviews are extremely important the good and the bad, and to have certain comments taken away because they hurt a houses reputation is wrong. It’s extremely unfair and misleading when trying to find a perfect house for a stay. That’s what reviews are for. So this review is to let those know who don’t know, that some reviews have removed anything that might hurt the houses chance of getting someone to stay. Anything you would want to know before selecting that house you might not be told because of this issue. Now I hope this review does not, not get posted because it’s not a good recommended review. It’s to help others be aware that their “5 star” house could actually be a lot less than a 5 star house.

title: Airbnb = antisemitic
text:
Airbnb has not allowed Jewish people in disputed areas of Israel to rent out their homes, while they still allow non Jewish people to rent out their homes in disputed areas. This is indisputably Anti-Semitic because there is a very long list of disputed lands around the globe, a lot of which are involved in horrific mistreatment of others that are still being rented from. Airbnb did not ban homes in Turkish occupied Cyprus, Moroccan occupied Sahara, China occupied Tibet, or Russia Occupied South Ossetia. This is completely unacceptable. They have been weak and have caved to an extremely anti- Semitic and horrifically biased anti-semitic movement, and by anti semitic, I mean Anti Jewish. Disgusting!

 If Airbnb decides to be reasonable and change their mind about this, I will take down this review. If it is still up, it means that they haven’t. 

Airbnb, you messed with the wrong crew. And if you want to be on the right side of history, you better change your policy soon, before you go completely out of business.
